For the semicolon (;) and colon.), it does not automatically delete the "space" prior like it does for the comma and period.

This is important, because if I want it to autocorrect the prior word, I need to press space to accept the suggestion, and the space also adds an actual space.  eg. shulf  -> shield    requires me to press space.
And when I do that, it fixes it and adds a space.

The quotation marks (") point in a particular direction, meaning that they are the same both at the beginning or at the end of a quote.

There are two ways to fix this, as I see it: (1) have the keyboard automatically put in the forward facing quotes if they come before a word ("likethis) and backwards facing at the end of a word (likethis"), OR (2) use neutral quotes that just go straight up and down.
